sentences.en: a patient who is exhibiting classic symptoms of mental illness
sentences.cn: 显现出精神病典型症状的患者

sentences.en: All of these cells exhibit motility .
sentences.cn: 所有这些细胞均表现移动性。

sentences.en: He had kindly offered to loan us all the plants required for the exhibit.
sentences.cn: 他善解人意地提出愿意把展览需要的植物通通借给我们。

sentences.en: He seems to want to exhibit his shame.
sentences.cn: 他似乎想要让大家知道自己感到羞愧。

sentences.en: Her paintings have been exhibited all over the world.
sentences.cn: 她的绘画作品在世界各地展出。

sentences.en: In this job you need to exhibit the wisdom of Solomon.
sentences.cn: 做这份工作需要表现出所罗门王一样的才智。

sentences.en: Lyalin soon began to exhibit the strain of leading a double life.
sentences.cn: 利亚林不久就显露出了双重生活的重压.

sentences.en: Nevertheless, Gorbachev made it a point to exhibit his own strength publicly.
sentences.cn: 然而, 戈尔巴乔夫决心公开展示自己的力量.

sentences.en: Next week those goods will exhibit in that shop.
sentences.cn: 下个星期,这些货物将在那家商店展出.

sentences.en: Now, after years of planning and work, the exhibit was taking shape.
sentences.cn: 现在, 经过几年的筹划和工作, 这个展览已初具规模.

sentences.en: Our company puts up exhibIt'stands at fairs and expositions.
sentences.cn: 我们的公司在展览会和博览会上推出展览点.

sentences.en: Proverbs exhibit most of the stylistic devices of poetry.
sentences.cn: 许多谚语具有诗的风格和手法.

sentences.en: Real crystals exhibit a variety of departures from this idealized structure.
sentences.cn: 真实晶体和这种理想的结构有种种出入.

sentences.en: The economy continued to exhibit signs of decline in September.
sentences.cn: 9月份，经济继续呈现出衰退的迹象。

sentences.en: Two cats or more in one house will also exhibit territorial behaviour.
sentences.cn: 一家若有两只或更多的猫，也会表现出争夺地盘的行为。

sentences.en: We're interested in importing a complete bottling machine for exhibit and sale.
sentences.cn: 我们有兴趣进口一整部装瓶机,以备展示和销售.

sentences.en: Why don't you exhibit your paintings in an art gallery?
sentences.cn: 你为什么不在美术馆展出你的画?

words.tran_cn: 展览，显示；展览会；展览品
展出者；获得奖学金的学生
裸露癖；自我宣传癖；喜出风头癖
裸露症患者；倾向自我宣传的人；喜欢出风头的人

trans.tran_cn: 展览品，（在法庭上出示的）证据
trans.tran_en: something, for example a painting, that is put in a public place so that people can go to see it
to show something in a public place so that people can go to see it
to show something in a public place so that people can go to see it

trans.tran_cn: 显示，显出；展出，展览，陈列
trans.tran_en: to show something in a public place so that people can go to see it
